layout.restartText: The device will be restarted. Ok?

logs.description: Check what is happening on the device.

dashboardPage.title: Dashboard
dashboardPage.subtitle: Hello, let's look some performance data.

hashRate.subtitle: Network's computational power
hashRate.description: Hash rate is a metric quantifying a network's computational power and efficiency. It represents the number of hash functions a transaction processor's hardware can compute within a second. A higher hash rate signifies that a processor can perform more computations within a given time.
hashRate.expHasRateHelp: Theoretical hash rate that the device should perform under the current configuration conditions (frequency and voltage).

shares.title: Shares
shares.subtitle: Miner’s shares proof of work
shares.description: A share represents a miner’s proof of work, essentially a valid solution to the cryptographic puzzle required to secure the blockchain. However, not all shares contribute to the discovery of a new block; those that do are termed ‘accepted shares,’ while their counterparts, ‘rejected shares,’ fail to make the cut due to various reasons such as timing issues or data errors.

swarmPage.title: Swarm
swarmPage.subtitle: Performance monitor of your swarm.
swarmPage.miningPowerSubtitle: Total hash rate of your swarm.
swarmPage.consumptionSubtitle: Total electrical consumption of your swarm.
swarmPage.noDeviceInfo: You need to add a device to check the total values of your swarm
swarmPage.restartDialog: The device will be restarted. Ok?
swarmPage.deleteDialog: The device will be deleted. Ok?

settingsPage.title: Settings
settingsPage.subtitle: Take control of your ASIC
settingsPage.fallbackPoolText: Secondary pool (used only if main fails)
settingsPage.restartText: The device will be restarted. Ok?
settingsPage.updateOk: Successful download. The page will refresh to apply the changes.
settingsPage.wwwFileError: The file must be named www.bin
settingsPage.espFileError: The file must be named esp-miner.bin
settingsPage.miningPowerDesc: More power, more Gh/s, but also more consumption and higher temperature.
settingsPage.tempTargetDesc: The fan speed will adjust until it attempts to reach the indicated temperature.
settingsPage.tempTargetInfo: ASIC chip temperature is considered safe below 70 degrees. Lower temperatures will prolong the ASIC lifespan. Please make you sure your bitaxe fan supports regulation. If not, always will run at full speed.

poolPage.title: Pool settings
poolPage.extraNounceInfo: Recommended option, especially if you have multiple miners connected to the same pool.

networkPage.title: Network
networkPage.subtitle: ASIC conection network
networkPage.restartText: The device will be restarted. Ok?
